intro: Galium boreale var. lancilimbum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
